content: this legal text summarizes the progress of a legal case that took place in ghent on march 28th 2019 the specific details about the cost and duration of the procedure are not mentioned but it lasted for a total of 1 year and 11 months the text outlines the steps involved in the legal process which are as follows 1 the first step is the filing of a complaint by one party against another party outlining the issues and grievances of the plaintiff 2 the defendant is then served with a copy of the complaint to ensure they are aware of the allegations made against them 3 the defendant has a certain period of time to respond to the complaint admitting or denying the allegations and presenting any counterclaims they have 4 both parties engage in a process called discovery where they gather evidence conduct interviews and exchange relevant information to build their cases 5 after discovery the parties may attempt to resolve the dispute through negotiation or mediation potentially resulting in a settlement agreement 6 if a settlement is not reached the case proceeds to trial where both parties present their arguments and evidence before a judge or jury 7 after the trial the judge or jury delivers a verdict determining the outcome of the case 8 if either party is dissatisfied with the verdict they have the option to appeal the decision and request a higher court to review the case the text does not provide information on the final outcome of the case or any further steps that may have been taken it discusses a legal case involving a marriage contract and the division of assets between surviving spouses and heirs the court emphasized the importance of transparency and the role of a notaryliquidator in clarifying joint ownership the court ordered the withdrawal of joint ownership and the division of the estate through a judicial liquidation process the text also explains the concept of joint ownership and the significance of a marriage contract with a residence clause it concludes by stating that preliminary liquidation of the matrimonial property is necessary before the withdrawal of joint ownership can take place the text also briefly mentions another legal case involving the evidence of investment in a joint property under a matrimonial property regime
